intro: Taeniophyllum kaniense, commonly known as the Kaniense Tillandsia, is a species of air plant belonging to the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of Brazil, particularly in the state of Pará. This epiphytic plant thrives on tree branches and absorbs moisture and nutrients through its specialized leaves. It has a compact rosette structure with dense, overlapping leaves that help retain water. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color.
